summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for Jeffrey Epstein from July to August 2019, including treatment refusal forms, dental exams, lab results, and clinical encounter notes. It details his medical condition, refusal of certain evaluations, and the emergency resuscitation event on August 10, 2019, the day he was found unresponsive in his cell. This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter record for inmate Jeffrey Epstein dated July 30, 2019, detailing a medical evaluation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The document records his reported symptoms, vital signs, medical assessments, and new medication orders, providing a snapshot of his health status while in custody.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of all medical records; an inmate at MCC New York who refuses several medical evaluations and is later found unresponsive in his cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical encounter. He reports various symptoms including numbness in his right arm, lack of sleep, and being without his medications for about a week.

connections.description: MD is the healthcare provider conducting a clinical evaluation and prescribing treatment for inmate Epstein.

events.title: Epstein refuses chest X-ray
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs a form refusing a recommended routine chest X-ray, acknowledging potential consequences.

events.title: Epstein refuses eye doctor evaluation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs multiple forms refusing a recommended ophthalmologic evaluation.

events.title: Epstein dental examination
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein undergoes an initial clinical dental examination at MCC New York.

events.title: Chronic care clinic evaluation
events.description: Epstein is evaluated in the chronic care clinic, reporting numbness in his right arm, lack of medications and CPAP machine, and various medical histories including hypertension and sleep apnea.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive / Cardiac arrest
events.description: Emergency response to Epstein's cell where he was found unresponsive, cold, with bruising around the neck, fixed pupils, and no palpable pulses. CPR was performed, he was intubated, and transported to a local ER with CPR in progress.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Evaluation in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is evaluated in the chronic care clinic at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. He reports symptoms including right arm numbness, insomnia, and being without his medications for a week. The provider documents his condition and prescribes new medications.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
Health Services Clinic, Bureau of Prisons
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein refused multiple recommended medical evaluations while in custody, including a chest X-ray and an eye doctor evaluation.
On August 10, 2019, Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York with 'circumferential bruising around the neck' and posterior mottling.
Epstein reported to medical staff on July 30, 2019, that he had been without his medications for about a week and had experienced numbness in his right arm.
Epstein had a history of sleep apnea and stated he had not slept for three weeks because he did not have access to his CPAP machine, which was later received by the facility.

The emergency resuscitation record details extensive life-saving measures, including CPR, intubation, and administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate, before he was transported to a local ER.
Jeffrey Epstein was evaluated in the Bureau of Prisons health services clinic on July 30, 2019, while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Epstein reported to the medical provider that he had been without his medications for about one week and had experienced numbness in his right arm a few days prior.
He also reported not having slept for three weeks because he did not have access to his CPAP machine for sleep apnea, though it was noted the machine would be given to him.
The medical assessment listed multiple current conditions including hypertension, hyperlipidemia, prediabetes, sleep apnea, low back pain, and neuralgia.
New medication orders were issued during this encounter, including Magnesium Hydroxide for constipation and Insulin sliding scale for prediabetes.
